div1.head: Military Orders for Robert P. Cooke and Lawrence [Walter L.] Reed, June 29, 1900
div1.p:
NOTED: RETURNS, A. G. O.,
9

Adjutant General's
OFFICE.
JUL 16 1900
ROLLS DIVISION.
[unclear]

ORDERS, BOOKS, BLANKS & D.C. DIV.
A. G. O.
RECD. JUL 12 1900

FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Vol 179 B 1900

HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF HAVANA
AND PINAR DEL RIO.
Quemados, Cuba, June 29, 1900.

SPECIAL ORDERS, }
No. 48. }
Cooke - L. Reed

1. Acting Assistant Surgeon George R. Plummer, U. S.
Army, is hereby relieved from the duty at Columbia Bar-
racks upon which he was detailed by paragraph 1, Special
Orders No. 36, c. s., these headquarters, and will rejoin
his former station, Battery No. 5, Artillery Defenses of
Havana.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

2. So much of paragraph 2, Special Orders No. 35, c. s.,
these headquarters, as relates to Private Roy Garber, Hos-
pital Corps, U. S. Army, is hereby revoked.

3. Corporal W. E. Chance, Company A, 8th Infantry, is
relieved from special duty at these headquarters, to date
from June 19th. 1900.

4. Private Jerry R. Thomas, Troop B, 7th Cavalry, hav-
ing been tried by a general court-martial convened at Co-
lumbia Barracks. Cuba, and found guilty of desertion, in
violation of the 47th Article of War (one previous convic-
tion), was sentenced “To be dishonorably discharged the ser-
vice of the United States, forfeiting all pay and allowances due
him, and to be confined at hard labor, at such place as the re-
viewing authority may direct, for one (1) year.”

The sentence is approved. In view of the confinement
already served by the accused whilst undergoing trial, one
month of the confinement awarded is remitted.

As mitigated the sentence will be duly executed, until
further orders, at Columbia Barracks, Cuba.

5. Acting Assistant Surgeon Robert P. Cooke, U. S. Army,
having reported for duty at these headquarters, in compli-
ance with paragraph 1, Special Orders No. 99, c. s., Head-
quarters Division of Cuba, is assigned to duty at Pinar del
Rio Barracks, Cuba, and will report for duty accordingly.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

6. A general court-martial is hereby appointed to meet
at Columbia Barracks, Cuba, at 10 o'clock A. M., Monday,
July 2d, or as soon thereafter as practicable, for the trial
of such persons as may be properly brought before it.
DETAIL FOR THE COURT.
Major B. K. Roberts, 2d Artillery;
Captain J. C. Gresham, 7th Cavalry;
Captain Charles Gerhardt, 8th Infantry;
1st Lieutenant F. H. Beach, 7th Cavalry;
1st Lieutenant W. H. Hart, 7th Cavalry;
1st Lieutenant M. C. Butler, 7th Cavalry;
1st Lieutenant E. J. Timberlake, 2d Artillery;
1st Lieutenant B. H. Merchant, 8th Infantry;
1st Lieutenant E. T. Collins, 8th Infantry;
2d Lieutenant B. H. Pope, 8th Infantry;

2d Lieutenant A. A. King, 7th Cavalry, judge advo-
cate.

A greater number of officers cannot be assembled with-
out manifest injury to the service.

The court is authorized to sit without regard to hours,
and is empowered to proceed with the business before it
with any number of members present not less than the
minimum prescribed by law.

7. A general court-martial is hereby appointed to meet
at Pinar del Rio Barracks, Cuba, at 10 o'clock A. M.,
Monday, July 2d, or as soon thereafter as practicable, for
the trial of such persons as may be properly brought before
it.
DETAIL FOR THE COURT.
Major J. J. O'Connell, 1st Infantry;
Captain N. P. Phister, 1st Infantry;
Captain T. B. Dugan, 7th Cavalry;
Captain W. M. Swaine, 1st Infantry;
Captain Charles E. Tayman, 1st Infantry;
1st Lieutenant C. H. Conrad, 7th Cavalry;
1st Lieutenant Campbell King, 1st Infantry;
2d Lieutenant Charles McClure, 1st Infantry;

2d Lieutenant W. L. Reed, 1st Infantry, judge advo-
cate.

A greater number of officers cannot be assembled with-
out manifest injury to the service.

The court is authorized to sit without regard to hours,
and is empowered to proceed with the business before it
with any number of members present not less than the
minimum prescribed by law.
BY COMMAND OF BRIGADIER GENERAL LEE:

R. E. L. MICHIE,
Assistant Adjutant General.
